sen.j: 小判（こばん）とは、江戸時代に流通した金貨の一種である。
sen.e: Koban is a kind of gold coin that was distributed in the Edo period.
Koban is a kind of gold coin that was distributed in the Edo period.
Koban is a kind of gold coin that was distributed in the Edo period.

sen.j: 公式な呼称は小判であり『三貨図彙』では「小判」と明記されているが、『金銀図録』および『大日本貨幣史』などの古銭書には小判金（こばんきん）という名称で収録されている。
sen.e: The formal name is koban, but in ancient coin book like Sankazue (Picture Collection of Three Coins: History of Coinage in Japan) it is called kobankin which is widely-accepted name among coin collecting world.

The formal name is koban, which was clearly mentioned in "Sankazue" (Picture Collection of Three Coins: History of Coinage in Japan), however, ancient coin books including "Kinginzuroku" (Gold & Silver catalog) and "Dainihon Kaheishi" (Great history of Japanese coins) called it kobankin, which is widely-accepted among coin collecting world.
sen.cmt: 原文に抜けがあり、Wikipediaには「公式な呼称は小判であり『三貨図彙』では「小判」と明記されているが、『金銀図録』および『大日本貨幣史』などの古銭書には小判金（こばんきん）という名称で収録されており、貨幣収集界では小判金の名称が広く用いられている。」となっておりますので、そのように修正しました
sen.e: The formal name is koban, which was clearly mentioned in "Sankazue" (Picture Collection of Three Coins: History of Coinage in Japan), however, ancient coin books including "Kinginzuroku" (Gold & Silver catalog) and "Dainihon Kaheishi" (Great history of Japanese coins) called it kobankin.
sen.cmt: チェッカーのコメントを受けて原文も修正しました。２文に分けました。一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 貨幣収集界では小判金の名称が広く用いられている。
sen.e: The name 'kobankin' is widely-accepted among coin collecting world.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 量目（質量）および金品位が一定に定められた計数貨幣である。
sen.e: It is counting currency with definite ryome (a weighed value) and karat.
It is counting currency with definite ryome (a weighed value) and karat.
It is counting currency with definite ryome (a weighed value) and karat.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 形状は、小判形と呼ばれる楕円形で表面には上下に扇枠に囲まれた桐紋（ごさんのきり）、中央上部に「壹两」下部に「光次（花押）」の極印が打たれている。
sen.e: It was oval called kobangata and on the surface Gosan no Kiri patterns were engraved in fan-shaped frames on the top and the bottom and at the top center '壹两' was engraved and at the bottom '光次' was engraved.

It was oval called kobangata and on the surface Gosan no Kiri mon (paulownia patterns) were engraved in fan-shaped frame on the top and the bottom and at the top center '壹两, or ichi ryo (one ryo)' was engraved and at the bottom a hallmark, '光次, or Koji (Kao written seal mark)', was engraved.
sen.cmt: Gosan no Kiri mon 用語共有に沿って修正しました。「壹两」の説明を補足しました。「光次」の説明を補足、修正しました。
sen.e: It was oval called kobangata and on the surface Gosan no Kiri mon (paulownia patterns) were engraved in fan-shaped frame on the top and the bottom and at the top center '壹两, or ichi ryo (one ryo)' was engraved and at the bottom a hallmark, '光次, or Koji (Kao written seal mark)', was engraved.

sen.j: 天下統一に先立ち、徳川家康は大判より小型のもので墨書を極印に改め一般流通を想定した通貨を発行する構想を持っていた。
sen.e: Before unification of the whole country, Ieyasu Tokugawa had a concept to issue currency which was smaller than oban with engraving in place of ink writing for general distribution and in 1601 Ieyasu ordered the Goto clan to cast Keicho koban and after that 10 kinds of currencies were issued until Manen koban in 1860.

Before unification of the whole country, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA had an idea to issue currency which was smaller than oban with engraving in place of ink writing for general distribution and in 1601 Ieyasu ordered the Goto clan to cast Keicho koban and after that 10 kinds of koban were issued until Manen koban in 1860.

Before his unification of the whole country, Ieyasu TOKUGAWA had planned to issue a form of currency for general distribution that would be smaller than the oban and would have an engraving instead of ink writing.
sen.cmt: 文を２つに分けました。一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 慶長6年(1601年)に徳川家康が後藤家に命じて鋳造させた慶長小判を嚆矢とし、万延元年(1860年)発行の万延小判まで10種が発行された。
sen.e: Starting with the Keicho koban (which Ieyasu ordered the Goto family to cast in 1601), 10 kinds of koban were issued before the issue of the Manen koban in 1860.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処Goto clan→Goto familyuntil→before the issue of

sen.j: 全国通用を前提とするものであるが、金鉱山が主に常陸国、甲斐国、伊豆国および佐渡国などに位置し、金貨の一般通用は家康により新たに取り入れられた政策であったため主に関東地方を中心に流通した。
sen.e: Supposing national distribution, it was distributed mainly in Kanto Region because gold mines were located in Hitachi, Kai, Izu and Sado Provinces and it was a newly adopted policy by Ieyasu.

It was planned to circulate nationwide, however, the distribution was mainly in Kanto Region because gold mines were located in Hitachi, Kai, Izu and Sado Provinces and the policy of circulating gold coins in public was newly adopted by Ieyasu.

It was planned to circulate nationwide, however, the distribution was mainly in Kanto Region because gold mines were located in Hitachi, Kai, Izu and Sado Provinces and the policy of circulating gold coins in public was newly adopted by Ieyasu.

sen.j: 額面は金一両。
sen.e: The face value was kin (gold) 1 ryo.
The face value was kin (gold) 1 ryo.
The face value was kin (gold) 1 ryo.

sen.j: これは本来質量単位としての一両の目方の砂金と言う意味であったが、鎌倉時代には金一両は五匁、銀一両は4.3匁と変化し、文明 (日本)16年（1484年）、室町幕府により京目（きょうめ）金一両は4.5匁（約16.8グラム）と公定され、それ以外のものは田舎目（いなかめ）とされた。
sen.e: This meant gold dust in weight of 1 ryo which was originally a mass unit, but in the Kamakura period kin 1 ryo was 5 monme and gin (silver) 1 ryo was 4.3 monme and in 1484 the Muromachi bakufu determined Kyome kin 1ryo as 4.5 monme (about 16.8 gram) and the others as inakame (unit of measure in old Japan).

This meant gold dust in weight of 1 ryo which was originally a mass unit, but in the Kamakura period kin 1 ryo was 5 monme and gin (silver) 1 ryo was 4.3 monme and in 1484 the Muromachi bakufu determined Kyome kin 1ryo as 4.5 monme (about 16.8 gram) and the others as inakame (unit of measure in old Japan).

This meant gold dust in weight of 1 ryo which was originally a mass unit, but in the Kamakura period kin 1 ryo was 5 monme and gin (silver) 1 ryo was 4.3 monme and in 1484 the Muromachi bakufu determined Kyome kin 1ryo as 4.5 monme (about 16.8 gram) and the others as inakame (unit of measure in old Japan).

sen.j: 安土桃山時代には四進法の通貨単位の便宜を図るためか、京目金一両は四匁四分と変化し、田舎目金一両は四匁前後となった。
sen.e: In the Azuchi-Momoyama period, to set the currency units in quaternary, kyome kin 1 ryo was changed to 4 monme 4 bu and inakame kin 1 ryo was changed to about 4 monme.
In the Azuchi-Momoyama period, to set the currency unit based on the quaternary notation system, kyome kin 1 ryo was changed to 4 monme 4 bu and inakame kin 1 ryo was changed to about 4 monme.
In the Azuchi-Momoyama period, to set the currency unit based on the quaternary notation system, kyome kin 1 ryo was changed to 4 monme 4 bu and inakame kin 1 ryo was changed to about 4 monme.

sen.j: 慶長小判はこの京目一両の原則に沿っていたが、後世、正徳 (日本)享保期を除き、時代ごとの経済政策により品位（金含有率）・量目ともに改悪されることが多かった。
sen.e: Keicho koban based on the principle of kyome 1ryo was later often made it worse in karat (content rate of gold) and ryome (a weighed value) according to each economic policies of each period except in Shotoku Kyoho period.

Keicho koban was made based on the principle of kyome 1ryo, however, later, due to economic policies of different periods except in Shotoku Kyoho period, it became often made worse both in karat (content rate of gold) and ryome (a weighed value).
sen.cmt: 文の構成を変更しました。
sen.e: Keicho koban was made based on the principle of kyome 1ryo, however, later, due to economic policies of different periods except in Shotoku Kyoho period, it became often made worse both in karat (content rate of gold) and ryome (a weighed value).

sen.j: また、幕末には、海外での金銀比価が日本国内と大きく異なったため、これを調整しようとして極端に小さな万延小判に改鋳された。
sen.e: Also in the end of Edo period, exchange ratio between gold and silver in abroad became much different to the domestic one, therefore extremely small Manen koban was casted to adjust the difference.
Also in the end of Edo period, exchange ratio between gold and silver abroad was so different from domestic one that extremely small Manen koban was casted to adjust the gap.
Also in the end of Edo period, exchange ratio between gold and silver abroad was so different from domestic one that extremely small Manen koban was casted to adjust the gap.

sen.j: 江戸時代には、小判同様の計数貨幣の金貨として、二分金、一分金、二朱金、一朱金がある。
sen.e: In the Edo period, there were nibukin, ichibukin, nishukin and isshukin as gold coins of counting currency like koban
In the Edo period, there were nibukin, ichibukin, nishukin and isshukin as gold coins of counting currency like koban.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを文末につけました。
sen.e: In the Edo period, there were nibukin, ichibukin, nishukin and isshukin as gold coins of counting currency like koban.

sen.j: この小判および分金の通貨単位は武田信玄による領国貨幣である甲州金の四進法（両、分、朱）を取り入れたものであった。
sen.e: The currency units of koban and bukin were adoptede quaternary (ryo, bu, shu) of Koshu gold which was territorial currency of Shingen TAKEDA.
The currency units of koban and bukin were based on the adopted quaternary (ryo, bu, shu) of Koshu gold which was territorial currency employed by Shingen TAKEDA.
The currency units of koban and bukin were based on the adopted quaternary (ryo, bu, shu) of Koshu gold which was territorial currency employed by Shingen TAKEDA.

sen.j: この内、一分判金は、小判の小額貨幣として常に小判と同品位、四分の一の量目でもって本位貨幣的に発行され、他の額面の貨幣は、品位すなわち含有される金の量目が小判に対して額面より少なく、補助貨幣的に発行された。
sen.e: Among those, a small amount currency of koban, ichibu bankin had same karat as koban and 1/4 ryome being issued as standard coin and the other ones with less karat and ryome than koban were issued as subsidiary currencies.

Among those, ichibu bankin was issued with the same karat as koban and in 1/4 ryome as standard coin, being a small amount currency of koban, had same karat as koban and 1/4 ryome being issued as standard coin, while the other ones with less karat and ryome than koban were issued as subsidiary currencies.
sen.cmt: 文の構成を変更しました。
sen.e: Among those, ichibu bankin was issued with the same karat as koban and in 1/4 ryome as standard coin, being a small amount currency of koban, had same karat as koban and 1/4 ryome being issued as standard coin, while the other ones with less karat and ryome than koban were issued as subsidiary currencies.

sen.j: 小判に対し、大判（大判金）も江戸時代を通して発行されていたが、大判は一般通貨ではなく、恩賞、贈答用のもので金一枚（四十四匁）という基準でつくられ、計数貨幣としてではなく、品位と量目および需要を基に大判大判相場によって取引された。
sen.e: As opposed to koban, oban (obankin) (large-sized old Japanese gold coin) were also issued through the Edo period, it was not general currency but as reward grants and gifts in the standard of kin 1 mai (44 monme) and was traded not as counting currency but as oban market rate based of the karat, ryome and demand.

As opposed to koban, oban (obankin) (large-sized old Japanese gold coin) were also issued through the Edo period, it was not general currency but as reward grants and gifts in the standard of kin 1 mai (44 monme) and was traded not as counting currency but as oban market rate based of the karat, ryome and demand.
sen.cmt: スペース調整をしました。
sen.e: As opposed to koban, oban (obankin) (large-sized old Japanese gold coin) were also issued through the Edo period, it was not general currency but as reward grants and gifts in the standard of kin 1 mai (44 monme) and was traded not as counting currency but as oban market rate based of the karat, ryome and demand.

sen.j: （強いて言えば秤量貨幣に近く、現代的に解釈すれば、金地金（インゴット）に相当するものと言える。
sen.e: When you come right down to it, it was more like a currency by weight and modernly interpreted it was equivalent to ingot.
When you come right down to it, it was more like a currency by weight and modernly interpreted, it was equivalent to ingot.
sen.cmt: コンマを追加しました。
sen.e: When you come right down to it, it was more like a currency by weight and modernly interpreted, it was equivalent to ingot.

sen.j: また、天保年間に大判と小判の中間的な貨幣として五両判が発行されたが、ほとんど流通しなかった。
sen.e: Also during the Tenpo period, goryoban was issued as a medieval currency between oban and koban, however it was seldom distributed.
Also during the Tenpo period, goryoban was issued as a medieval currency between oban and koban, however it was seldom distributed.
Also during the Tenpo period, goryoban was issued as a medieval currency between oban and koban, however it was seldom distributed.

sen.j: なお、明治以降新貨条例が施行され、1両は1円 (通貨)と等価とされ、（二分金の金銀含有量の実質価値と日本の金貨一円金貨 の純金含有量の価値がほぼ等しかった。
sen.e: Since the Meiji period, the New Currency Act became effective and 1 ryo was determined as equivalent to 1 yen (the value of contained amount of gold and silver of nibukin and purity of gold of 1 yen coin were almost equivalent).

Since the Meiji period, the New Currency Act became effective and 1 ryo was determined as equivalent to 1 yen (the value of contained amount of gold and silver of nibukin and purity of gold of 1 yen coin were almost equivalent).

Since the Meiji period, the New Currency Act became effective and 1 ryo was determined as equivalent to 1 yen (the value of contained amount of gold and silver of nibukin and purity of gold of 1 yen coin were almost equivalent).

sen.j: ）古金銀はそれぞれの含有金銀量に基づいて定められた交換比率で新貨幣と交換された。
sen.e: Old gold and silver were exchanged to new currencies in exchange rates based of contained amount of gold and silver.
Old gold and silver were exchanged to new currencies in exchange rates based of contained amount of gold and silver.
Old gold and silver were exchanged to new currencies in exchange rates based of contained amount of gold and silver.

sen.j: 三菱東京UFJ銀行貨幣資料館、貨幣博物館および造幣博物館には小判が体系的に展示されている。
sen.e: Koban are on display in Currency Museum Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ and Currency Museum of the Bank of Japan and Mint Museum systematically.
Koban are on display in Currency Museum Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ and Currency Museum of the Bank of Japan and Mint Museum systematically.
Koban are on display in Currency Museum Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ and Currency Museum of the Bank of Japan and Mint Museum systematically.
